headline.main: Poverty and Disease in Carolina Low Country Belie the New South Boom; Poverty and Disease Belie the South's Boom

byline.original: By WAYNE KING Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: BEAUFORT, S.C. South Carolina's Low Country is a sobering reminder that not all of the vast region below the Mason-Dixon line is a booming New South. Statistically, Southerners remain the poorest, sickest and worst-educated regional population segment in the country, and it is arguable that these grim facts are nowhere more evident than they are here, despite the successes of federally underwritten efforts to combat poverty and disease.
docs.snippet: BEAUFORT, S.C. South Carolina's Low Country is a sobering reminder that not all of the vast region below the Mason-Dixon line is a booming New South. Statistically, Southerners remain the poorest, sickest and worst-educated regional population...
